titleStmt.title: Independency accused by nine severall arguments: written by a godly learned minister, to a member of Mr. John Goodwins congregation, and acquitted by severall replyes to the said arguments by a member of the same church. In both which, sweetnesse of spirit, and soundnesse of arguments have been endeavoured. Published according to order.
titleStmt.author: I. P.

titleStmt.title: Independency accused by nine severall arguments: written by a godly learned minister, to a member of Mr. John Goodwins congregation, and acquitted by severall replyes to the said arguments by a member of the same church. In both which, sweetnesse of spirit, and soundnesse of arguments have been endeavoured. Published according to order.
titleStmt.author: I. P.

publicationStmt.publisher: Printed for Henry Overton in Popes-head Alley,

notesStmt.note: "A member of the same church" = I.P., who has signed the work on page [3] and at end.
Reproduction of the original in the British Library.
